data.title: Selection:expandOverWord incorrectly selects delimiters if selection touches one
data.body:
Using `-` as the start and end of a selection, when text like `"fo-oo-o"` is selected, `expandOverWord` correctly selects `"-foooo-"`. But if `"-fo-ooo"` is selected, `expandOverWord` incorrectly selects `-"foooo-"`.

A gif perhaps explains better:

![atom-wrong-selection](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12676/11448890/c52215ea-9528-11e5-9f56-947f0b76ae12.gif)

This is used by vim-mode's `select-inside-word` (`diw`). A workaround for some cases was recently landed in https://github.com/atom/vim-mode/pull/890, but does not fix all cases, particularly the one I've illustrated here. cc @maxbrunsfeld

data.title: Spinner icon when launching on 15.10
data.body:
When I first launch Atom on Ubuntu 15.10, and hover over the top bar with the menus, the cursor icon remains a spinning "wait" icon, even though the app is loaded and working. (It's a new, fast computer, too).

If I open a new window, the icon finally goes away and switches to the expected arrow cursor.

data.title: Replace All button not active until find is done
data.body: I think the "Replace All" button should do a find then replace instead of having to click find and then click replace all. The user will be prompted to confirm so it seems like an unneeded step.

data.title: Open involuntary new window when dragging in a file
data.body:
Whenever I drag a file from the file brower (nautilus on ubuntu), atom opens a new window. This seemed to have changed now that I updated from 1.1.0 to 1.2.4. There have been issues like this before (https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2005 and https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1722), but this one seems a bit different:
- Files from outside of the current project directory open in a new window. If I close this new window again, then drag another file from that same directory (still outside of the project directory) into the original window, again a new window opens, but this time with the file that I just dragged AND the one that I dragged before (and closed again). So it seems, atom is internally creating something like a project and stores which files were opened from that directory.
- Even more interestingly, something similar happens when dragging files from the current project directory: A new window is opened for this file, too, but it also contains all the files that were open in the original window. Thus, I get a copy of the original window.

Working with
atom 1.2.4
ubuntu 14.04

data.title: OnDidChange TextEvent values not set correctly upon single newline character.
data.body:
### Reproduce:

Subscribe to the TextEditor OnDidChange event and simply output the TextEvent object to the console log.
Enter a newline into a new text buffer in the UI (Hit Enter/Return) to fire off the OnDidChange event.
Examine the logged console object:
1. The TextEvent object field 'newText' does not include the newline character, it is an empty String.
2. The oldRange values are incorrect for the end/start fields.  They show the same position as the newRange.

Compare this to a backspace/delete that removes the newline and moves the cursor up one row.
The TextEvent object field 'oldText' includes the newline character that was deleted.
I think the two operations should be inverses, and the values of oldText/newText fields mirrors of each other in either situation at the very least.

_Update:_
The TextEvent does fire, but an additional TextEvent with invalid information also occurs.

**Atom Version:** 1.2.4
**System:** Ubuntu 14.04.3
### Done When:

The additional event that describes no change (newText and oldText both empty Strings) does not occur.

data.title: Standard Debugging/Run UI
data.body:
I've been loving Atom, but I feel like we can make it a better overall development experience.

Some packages are starting to add linting, building, and even debugging into them for certain languages. However, the UI is inconsistent between them. I propose that we expand the current Atom API to create tools to make one, unified experience for every language.

I think having a standard UI for breakpoints/errors/warnings on the line numbers, a console windows (with run/pause buttons), and a standard debugger (a panel for variables and for the stack trace) would make everything smoother and encourage people to add packages for debuggers and such for many languages. If the UI is setup, it could be as easy as calling an external debugger with the command line.

It's this way for autocorrect in Atom: I can have different autocomplete packages that all function essentially the same.

Is this something we do outside of the Atom core?

data.title: Headless testing doesn't show deprecations
data.body:
One of the coolest features of the original test infrastructure is that it displayed deprecations when you ran tests:

![screen shot 2015-11-26 at 10 27 16 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1038121/11429133/99c3b26a-9428-11e5-9018-b74ba2d43495.png)

The new headless testing system (and also `apm test`) doesn't support this feature:

```
[atom-test-deprecate][~/Source/tabs-to-spaces] atom --test spec
Error Downloading Update: Could not get code signature for running application
[54439:1126/102639:INFO:CONSOLE(51)] "Window load time: 280ms", source: file:///Users/Lee/github/atom/static/index.js (51)
............................

Finished in 1.47 seconds
28 tests, 32 assertions, 0 failures, 0 skipped
```

I don't want us to lose this valuable piece of feedback for package authors.

I added the `atom-test-deprecate` branch to my [tabs-to-spaces package](https://atom.io/packages/tabs-to-spaces) for easy testing of this feature.

data.title: Feature: "Open recent..." submenu in the "File" menu in the OSX menubar
data.body:
OS X El Capitan, Atom v1.2.4

Sublime Text has an "Open recent..." submenu under the "File" menu in the menu bar

![screen shot 2015-11-26 at 18 53 26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7525670/11428754/4209c914-946f-11e5-998d-2bc4549421c0.png)

which looks like this when open:

![screen shot 2015-11-26 at 18 54 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7525670/11428758/490e2de0-946f-11e5-8ae4-409679190b60.png)

Where the upper list is a list of recent files and the lower list is a list of recent projects that were open. I used this feature a lot, and I sorely miss it from Atom. Maybe there is a different way of doing this in Atom, but I haven't found it yet and would love to see this added.

Cheers!

data.title: Cannot test newly created package
data.body:
When I try to run package specs, I get `Error: Cannot find module fs-plus/underscore-plus`. If I install those packages manually and try `apm test` from console, then I get;

`registerProtocol API has been replaced by the register[File/Http/Buffer/String]Protocol API family, please switch to the new APIs.` coming from `electron/protocol.coffee`. Am I testing my package wrong or something? What should I do?

OSX Yosemite
Atom 1.2.4

data.title: Wrong version number on OS X
data.body:
The Mac binary has the version number stuck at 1.1.0, even after updating to newer versions.

This causes the release notes tab to not show newer notes than 1.1.0 and show the ”Restart and update” button. If you are already running the latest version (as I am), all the button does is quit the app.

The ”About” tab shows the correct version.

data.title: When creating a new file, atom doesn't allow to enter a file name
data.body:
**EDIT:**

I closed Atom Beta and then relaunched it, and the issue was gone. So if you want you can close this thread and mark it as resolved, thanks.

---

I'm trying to create a new file inside a folder but I'm unable to do so because Atom doesn't allow me to enter a file name for it. I'm actually testing Atom v1.3.0-beta6 on Mac OS X 10.11.1.

This is what I'm doing :

1) I move the mouse pointer over a folder in the tree-view of atom
2) I right-click and choose "New file" from the pop-up menu
3) A pop-up box appears on the upper center of the Atom window, asking me to enter the file name
4) I click over the pop-up box but when I try to write with the keyboard nothing happens.
5) After a 10-20 seconds, a pop-up window appears with this message: "EDITOR IS NOT RESPONDING - The editor is not responding. Would you like to force close or just keep waiting?"

Here's a screenshot of what I see on my computer:

![index_jade_-__users_scala_documents_progetti_progetti_html-css_promo_allascala_it_-_atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/605017/11420530/f10c25e2-942e-11e5-8443-0dfeb69184c8.jpg)

![index_jade_-__users_scala_documents_progetti_progetti_html-css_promo_allascala_it_-_atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/605017/11420536/f6a55c08-942e-11e5-9843-6c8cacc34fad.jpg)

data.title: Adding new-line bind in keymap.cson not working
data.body:
I've added a bind for shift+enter in my keymap.cson, but when I press shift+enter in my code files nothing happens. Added it like so:

```
'atom-text-editor':
  'shift-enter': 'editor:new-line'
```

I checked the "Key Binding Resolver" (ctrl+.) and pressed shift-enter and it says:

editor:new-line, atom-text-editor, /home/me/.atom/keymap.cson

The line is green, has a tick beside it, and it says "No issues".

Any ideas?

data.title: When creating a new file, atom doesn't allow to enter a file name
data.body:
I'm trying to create a new file inside a folder but I'm unable to do so because Atom doesn't allow me to enter a file name for it. I'm actually testing Atom Beta v1.3.0-beta6 on Mac OS X 10.11.1.

This is what I'm doing :

1) I move the mouse pointer over a folder in the tree-view of atom
2) I right-click and choose "New file" from the pop-up menu
3) A pop-up box appears on the upper center of the Atom window, asking me to enter the path to the new file
4) I move the cursor over the pop-up box and the mouse pointer changes to the edit mode. However when I click on it and I try to write with the keyboard, nothing happens.
5) After a 10-20 seconds, a pop-up window appears with this message: "EDITOR IS NOT RESPONDING - The editor is not responding. Would you like to force close or just keep waiting?"

Here's a screenshot of what I see on my computer:

![index_jade_-__users_scala_documents_progetti_progetti_html-css_promo_allascala_it_-_atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/605017/11420309/9b3d3e5e-942d-11e5-9a70-42c67909b038.jpg)

data.title: Do not override user-defined keymaps when reloading packages
data.body:
Depends on https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/pull/105.
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/100.

In this PR we use the new `priority` parameter to prevent packages from overriding user-defined keymaps.
- [x] :arrow_up: atom-keymap after :ship:ping the related PR (this will make specs :green_heart:)

/cc: @nathansobo @maxbrunsfeld @atom/feedback

data.title: Failed to load the textstats package
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. `$ atom .` 
2. Atom would then open with the warning

**Atom Version**: 1.2.4
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.5

data.title: Confusing Tip When Atom is Opened
data.body: When I open Atom and have no tabs open, tips are displayed to me and change every few seconds. One of the tips is "You can split a pane with 'Ctrl + K Right'". I'm not sure what the 'Right' here means. Perhaps better wording should be adopted.

data.title: Inconsistencies in Menu Items
data.body:
I have noticed two inconsistencies in menu items.
The first is under View->Toggle Tree View. The hotkey for this menu item is labelled 'Ctrl+Backslash' This goes against the adopted convention of hotkey labels that are usually like 'Shift+Ctrl+=' instead of 'Shift+Ctrl+Equals' or 'Shift+Ctrl+-' instead of 'Sift+Ctrl+minus'.
The second inconsistency is the same idea as the first, and is under Selection->Single Selection. The hotkey is labelled 'Escape', while the key on the keyboard is labelled 'Esc'.

data.title: Atom 1.2.4 on windows7 x64 carsh to open big git folder (git pack > 800M)
data.body:
This issue is 100% percent happen when i try to open a folder with git repository which has a big history in .git.

when first i worked with a folder with few commits. atom works fine.
when i add more changes(remove many files and then add many). the git index and pack file is large.
then Atom is crashed to open the folder.
even i updated to latest 1.2.4 version.

data.title: Crashes or hangs when reloading large file
data.body:
I have a large file (11,266 lines) that's being generated from a code generation script.  If I leave that file open in Atom and regenerate the code, which is done by redirecting stdout from a Python script, Atom will regularly hang or outright crash.  Sometimes you can do this a half dozen times, other times it will hang or crash on the first rewrite of the file.

Expected behavior is to refresh and reload the file in Atom.

As seen in Atom 1.0.6 and 1.2.4 on Ubuntu 15.04.  Happens in safe mode as well.

Also reproducible in OSX with Atom 1.2.2 and 1.2.4.  Will be attaching the crash logs from Console.app shortly.

How I can reliably reproduce the bug (requires Python 2.7, `pip install html2text`):

From the https://github.com/DualSpark/rusoto/tree/feature-better-s3-codegen branch, run: 

``` bash
git submodule init
git submodule update
```

``` bash
cd codegen
./botocore_parser_s3.py botocore/botocore/data/s3/2006-03-01/service-2.json S3Client > s3.rs
```

That generates the code.  Now, open `codegen/s3.rs` in Atom and re-run the `./botocore_parser_s3.py botocore/botocore/data/s3/2006-03-01/service-2.json S3Client > s3.rs` command.  Atom will hang reloading the file, or crash outright.  If it doesn't crash or hang, running the command a few more times will cause a hang or crash.  Once or twice for Ubuntu, four to five times for OSX.

data.title: OSX 10.10.5 - Files locking up on smb connection
data.body:
I'm editing files on a mounted volume (connected via SMB). 

When I try to discard changes on a file w/ Git the file locks up and i get a "Permission Denied" message in atom. I can not delete the file in finder as well. 

I then need to disconnect from the mounted volume or reboot to get the file back.

Please help.

data.title: OSX: open windows list disappeared
data.body:
I usually have 3 to 8 open Atom windows with different projects, and used to switch between them with the Window menu that used to list all the open windows. Recently it just stopped working - only shows generic options: Minimize, Zoom, Bring all to front.

Atom 1.2.4
OSX 10.11.1

data.title: Atom does not launch unless done by `sudo atom` in terminal - Ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
As the title suggests, after installing Atom for the first time on an Ubuntu 14.04 machine, Atom does not load when either the icon is clicked or when launched by the terminal with `atom`. The icon pops up in the launcher, but no window is ever launched. 

After filtering for the word `atom` in `htop`, I can see that the following processes are being run on my system (see image below).

When trying to launch Atom in safe mode, I get the following output, followed by my terminal hanging indefinitely.

```
[03:37 PM] [~] $ /usr/bin/atom: line 106: /home/lancelafontaine/.atom/nohup.out: Permission denied
App load time: 275ms


```

However, when typing `sudo atom` in the terminal, a window does end up launching (see image).

In the Atom menu in the top bar, there are the following options: `[Check for Update, Reload, Close Window, Toggle Dev Tools, Quit]`

The Dev Tools console displays the following message.

```
Error: EACCES: permission denied, open '/home/lancelafontaine/.atom/compile-cache/less/df1b7fbc57dbeed23a8f1f8de95b4dfebcc06066/imports.json'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:549:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:137:20)
    at Object.fs.writeFileSync (fs.js:1171:15)
    at Object.fsPlus.writeFileSync (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/fs-plus/lib/fs-plus.js:279:17)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.writeJson (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:155:17)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.setImportPaths (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:113:12)
    at new LessCache (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:32:12)
    at new LessCompileCache (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/less-compile-cache.js:20:20)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.loadLessStylesheet (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:270:26)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.loadStylesheet (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:257:21)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.requireStylesheet (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:174:24)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.reloadBaseStylesheets (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:237:12)
    at ThemeManager.module.exports.ThemeManager.loadBaseStylesheets (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/theme-manager.js:232:19)
    at new AtomEnvironment (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:246:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/initialize-application-window.js:28:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/initialize-application-window.js:49:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:434:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .js] (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:190:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
    at setupWindow (file:///usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/static/index.js:79:5)
    at window.onload (file:///usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/static/index.js:35:9)handleSetupError @ index.js:56
```

**Reproduction Steps and Observed Behavior:**
1. Whenever launched via Launcher icon, no window appears.
2. Whenever launched via terminal with `atom`, no window appears.

**Expected behavior:**

Expected behaviour is that the editor launches a window and loads.

**Screenshots and GIFs**

![screenshot from 2015-11-25 15 20 19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548285/11408590/2a926d3c-9388-11e5-9416-274c1d13d36a.png)

However, when typing `sudo atom` in the terminal, a window does end up launching (see image).

![screenshot from 2015-11-25 15 22 37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548285/11408825/a4db0bc0-9389-11e5-8073-baf0f159270b.png)

**Atom version:** 1.2.4
**OS and version:** Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

**Installed packages:**

This occurs when launching Atom for the first time after install. Only the default packages are included in atom.

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: Yes
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes
